result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teyanna A Poe

defendant.name: Poe, Teyanna A
defendant.address: 3010 S 5th St Apt 25, South Milwaukee, WI 53172

records.addlTxt: Upon receipt of a competency status update letter from OCRP, Court scheduled a hearing on November 10, 2022 at 1:30 PM to address the letter.  Parties notified of court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Received and Filed: Competency Status Update Letter

Defendant Teyanna A Poe appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Teyanna A Poe.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Doctor's Report Return.  Court vacates stayed bench warrant.  It is the opinion of Doctor Sanchez that Ms. Poe remains incompetent to proceed and not likely to regain competency within the statutory timeframe.  State requests a competency hearing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Doctor Sanchez notified of court date for testimony.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Competency hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Competency Report Dated 10-19-22

Defendant Teyanna A Poe not in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Teyanna A Poe.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Doctor's Report Return. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided update regarding Defendant failure to appear, and requested Bench Warrant be imposed and stayed. State did not object. Court ordered Bench Warrant imposed but stayed. Court ordered case adjourned, Branch 2.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Doctor Sergio Sanchez Extension Letter

Defendant Teyanna A Poe in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case set for return on doctors report.  Parties review and do not contest doctor report.  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense. Court orders proceedings suspended. Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services and referral for Out Patient Restoration Program in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. The Court further authorized DHS to administer medications or treatment to the defendant.  Defendant is out of custody. Order of Commitment signed and filed. Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report, Branch 02.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for return on doctor report. Statements by defense regarding non appearance. Defense counsel requests a short adjournment. State requests the Court impose and stay a warrant. Defense has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Teyanna A Poe in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

ADDRESS INFO for Teyanna A Poe
Current: 3010 S 5th St Apt 25, South Milwaukee, WI 53172 United States  (Effective: 05-10-2022)
Prior: 9241 South Chicago Road, Oak Creek, WI 53154

Defendant Teyanna A Poe in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Teyanna A Poe in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Teyanna A Poe appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3 and 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
